body_html:
@karmel I have another file which just reads the data when I read the file through it. Yes it gives the error of "Dataloss" as expected but when type the command

sudo sh -c "sync; echo 1 > /proc/sys/vm/drop_caches"

It works fine after that. But after a while, the error comes back with a different record.
Btw -->
The record is of following type -
tf.train.Example(features=tf.train.Features(feature={
'file_name': _str_feature(filename),
'float_image': _float_feature(image_t[i] + reader.mean_pixel),
'image_raw': _bytes_feature(org_image_t[i].tostring()),
'lambda_image': _float_feature(lambda_val[i])
}))
file_name is just a string
float_image is a 256x256x3 float matrix
image_raw is a 256x256x3 byte matrix
lambda_image is a 256x256x3 float matrix

body:
@karmel I have another file which just reads the data when I read the file through it. Yes it gives the error of "Dataloss" as expected but when type the command 

> sudo sh -c "sync; echo 1 > /proc/sys/vm/drop_caches"

It works fine after that. But after a while, the error comes back with a different record.
Btw --> 
The record is of following type - 
 tf.train.Example(features=tf.train.Features(feature={
                                'file_name': _str_feature(filename),
                                'float_image': _float_feature(image_t[i] + reader.mean_pixel),
                                'image_raw': _bytes_feature(org_image_t[i].tostring()),
                                'lambda_image': _float_feature(lambda_val[i])
                            }))
file_name is just a string 
float_image is a 256x256x3 float matrix 
image_raw is a  256x256x3 byte matrix 
lambda_image is a 256x256x3 float matrix
